references.reason: This paper introduces the nearest neighbor rule, which is the central focus of the current paper.
This seminal paper establishes the foundation for analyzing the nearest neighbor rule's consistency under i.i.d. assumptions, providing a benchmark for comparison.

references.paper_title: On the strong universal consistency of nearest neighbor regression function estimates
references.reason: This paper significantly advances the understanding of the nearest neighbor rule's consistency, offering insights into its behavior beyond i.i.d. assumptions.

references.paper_title: Rates of convergence of nearest neighbor estimation under arbitrary sampling
references.reason: This paper provides crucial analysis on the nearest neighbor rule's convergence rates under various sampling conditions, extending the scope of theoretical understanding.

references.paper_title: Learning whenever learning is possible: Universal learning under general stochastic processes
references.reason: This recent work significantly expands the theoretical framework for universal online learning, which is relevant to the context of the current paper's analysis of the nearest neighbor rule under non-i.i.d. settings.
